topic.title: Migrating MS Office Documents to DITA

body.p: integrates the entire DITA for Publishers plugins suite and provides some possibilities for migrating content from Microsoft OfficeÂ® (and other Office-type formats) to DITA. There are also possibilities for migrating various other types of formats. For more information, see .

Migration from Office-type formats to XML is rarely perfect and manual changes may need to be made to the converted content, but the methods described below should help you find the best approach for your particular case.

section.title: Batch Converter Add-on (Multiple Documents)
section.p: The provided Word to DITA conversion of the Oxygen Batch Converter add-on contains an option named Create DITA maps from Word documents containing multiple sections. When this option is selected, all sections from your Word document marked by titles or headings will be separated into individual DITA topics and referenced in a DITA map.

ol.li: Open the document in MS Office (or other similar application), select all the content, and copy it.
Open and create a new DITA topic.
Paste the selected content in Author mode. The Smart Paste functionality will attempt to convert the content to DITA structure.
Save your document as HTML.

Once you have converted it to HTML, you have several possibilities:
In , select File Import HTML File to import it as XHTML. Then, open the XHTML in and use one of the XHTML to DITA transformation scenarios to convert the content to DITA structure.
Open the HTML file in any web browser, select all of its content, and copy it. Then, open , create a new DITA topic, and paste the selected content in Author mode. The Smart Paste functionality will attempt to convert the HTML content to DITA structure.

section.title: Word to LibreOffice to DITA (Single Document)

ol.li: Open the document in the LibreOffice application and save it as DocBook.
Open the DocBook document in .
Run the built-in DocBook to DITA transformation scenario.
You may need to make some manual adjustments for elements that could not be mapped.

section.title: Word to DITA using DITA For Publishers (Single Document)

ol.li: Save the document in the MS Word DOCX format.
Open it in the Archive Browser view in and then open the document.xml file contained in the archive.
Run the built-in DOCX DITA transformation scenario. This scenario runs a build file over the DOCX archive and should produce a DITA project that contains a DITA map and multiple topics.
You may need to do some manual reconfiguration to map DOCX styles to DITA content. The XSLT conversion is part of the DITA For Publishers plugin and there is documentation for it available here: .

section.title: Word to DocBook to DITA (Multiple Documents)

ol.li: Use a tool to convert the documents to DocBook. For example, Pandoc is a free document converter engine that can convert DOCX documents to DocBook and according to Pandoc's manual, you can specify multiple input files and use wildcards in the commands.
Save the newly converted DocBook documents somewhere in your project.

Perform a batch transformation on all the newly converted DocBook documents:
Select all the DocBook documents in the ProjectProject Explorer view.
Right-click the selected files and choose Transform Configure Transformation Scenario(s) .
Apply the built-in DocBook to DITA transformation scenario.
You may need to make some manual adjustments in the resulting documents for elements that could not be mapped.

section.title: Word to HTML/Markdown to DITA (Multiple Documents)

ol.li: Use a tool to convert the documents to HTML or Markdown. For example, Pandoc is a free document converter engine that can convert DOCX documents to those formats.
Use Oxygen's Batch Converter add-on to convert the documents to DITA.
You may need to make some manual adjustments in the resulting documents for elements that could not be mapped.

section.title: Migrating Excel and Other Types of Spreadsheets to DITA
section.p:
There are two possibilities for converting Microsoft Excel (or other similar types of documents) to DITA:
Copy the spreadsheet content and paste it in a DITA topic in Author mode. The Smart Paste functionality will attempt to convert the content to DITA.
Use Oxygen's Batch Converter add-on to convert one or more spreadsheet documents to DITA.

section.title: Migrating Excel and Other Types of Spreadsheets to DITA
section.p: It is possible to convert Microsoft Excel (or other similar types of documents) to DITA. To do this, copy the spreadsheet content and paste it in an open DITA topic in Author mode. The Smart Paste functionality will attempt to convert the content to DITA structure.
